column1: Nagari was much troubled at this saying
column2: and marveled greatly. Then one woman made bold to rise up
column5: she went to seek the sweet music. Now this woman never returned. After a time, another woman arose and said, Stay here
column6: my friends; I shall return."Then she went in like manner to look for the music. And she returned not. And so with each woman
column7: until Nagari was left sitting alone as he had been at the beginning.Now Webubu was still playing his flute on the platform he had built in the corkwood tree
column8: when the women came in sight. He was alarmed for the safety of his frail platform
column9: when he saw these many people advancing
column11: "Come not up into the tree. Remain below
column13: O women!"But the women were consumed with eagerness to be close to the music which had taken their hearts
column16: until they were upon the platform of Webubu.
